messages.title: 2010: THE YEAR OF CHANGE
messages.content: The country is one of the most important constituencies in the upcoming national election. The election of David Cameron as Prime Minister hinges on electing a Conservative MP in Kingswood.

messages.title: STANDING UP FOR LOCAL FACILITIES
messages.content: Chris Skidmore, who was born locally and lives in Bitton, has a proven track record of campaigning to ensure our community remains resilient.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: By increasing investment year on year; Restoring our battered economy and tackling Labour's chronic debt; Improving our schools by increasing flexibility in curricula and expanding small schools options.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: NO WAY TO 33,000 HOUSES CAMPAIGN CONTINUES
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Opposing the Labour Government's Green Belt policy; protecting our much loved Green Belt.
Opposing the downgrading of the hospital and under-funding; advocating for the improvement in local services.

issues.economy: Restoring our battered economy and tackling Labour's chronic debt.
issues.education: Improving our schools by increasing flexibility in curricula and expanding smaller school options.
issues.environment: Protecting our Green Belt with no loss of local residents' trust to those with corporate and damaging greed.
issues.health: The Conservatives are committed to increasing spending on the NHS every year with the following Conservative proposals.

housing.content: Opposing the Labour Government's Green Belt policy; protecting our much loved Green Belt.

leaflet.personalStatement: With no real hospital since the last Labour government, I've made it my mission to ensure our Green Belt is protected from corporate and damaging greed.

politicalExperience.achievements: Campaigning for local facilities; opposition to 33,000 houses policy; fighting for local hospital services.

images.caption: Chris Skidmore with local residents in Longwell Green.
Chris joins Kingswood MP Roger Berry on a visit to local businesses.
Chris at a packed meeting talking about the future of Frenchay Hospital.

leaflet.additionalNotes: 2010 is the year for change – this is your chance to tell us what changes you want to see.
